The dosage of comedy is far more potent than the drama and romance, allowing for a chemistry that perfectly dodges anything too far-fetched or overemotional. The Baltimore and New York settings also add an element of class to this long-but-not-boring outing of proudly unusual friendships and love. Easily one of the best movies of the 1990s.**** (out of four)

title: "...possibly Nicholson's best performance"
content: I don't normally give a 10 out of 10 rating to a romantic comedy, but As Good As It Gets couldn't get much better. In what is possibly Nicholson's best performance (and being a fan of performances in The Shining, Cuckoo's Nest, A Few Good men, The Pledge, and many more... I do not say this lightly), As Good As It Gets is not lacking to those who crave great acting, story, character development and humor.Nicholson and Helen Hunt were indeed Oscar worthy while Greg Kinnear, Cuba Gooding Jr., Shirley Knight, Skeet Ulrich, and Harold Ramis are superb in their supporting roles. I have seen this movie countless times, and never grow weary of it!

title: As Terrible as Possible
content: Badly written, badly plotted, badly directed. I felt truly sorry for the unfortunate actors condemned to work with this ultra-dorky material. If it was supposed to be funny, it wasn't. If it was supposed to be appealing, it didn't. There was nothing sympathetic about any of the characters, and they managed to be supremely uninteresting at the same time. I was bored rigid by these cardboard characters. I cannot believe anyone outside America finds anything redeeming about this mechanical disaster. There is some kind of a popular culture gap as wide as the Atlantic between those who enjoy this kind of film and those who don't. Some very great films have been produced in America, but the majority, I would say about 80%, of them have had European directors. Oscar is a very eccentric fellow, and this time he amazed me.

title: I loved it!
content: Well I started this movie for Jack Nicholson, but then realised that Helen Hunt and Greg Kinnear are amazing as well.The story is plain and simple, A misanthropic Jack Nicholson's character is bigoted and has OCD.Greg Kinnear is his neighbour and painter who's also gay. They don't have a good relationship. Greg's character is unfortunately involved in a mishap.On the other side Helen Hunt's character is a single mother looking after her mother and son having asthama.Jack then happens to be in between doing favours and this small deed changes him completely.In the process makes him a better man.There are some 2-3 scenes of 30-45 secs where a kid is not suppose to watch.Altogether a great romantic comedy. Must watch with your loved ones.

title: A Great Script plus Great Acting Makes This a Great Movie
content: This is a great movie. It had a very funny script and the acting was spectacular. Jack Nicholson definitely deserved his third Oscar for this, he was funny and added the right to his character. Helen Hunt also deserved her Oscar she was excellent and also funny. Greg Kinnear was pretty good also, he deserved his nomination.I give this movie a 9 out of 10, I would give it a 10 its just that I could never give a romantic comedy a 10.

title: The awakeining of the human spirit
content: Jack Nicholson plays Melvin Udall, a crudmugeon writer that is homophobic and has obessions complusive disorder. He has too eat food with plastic ware, sit on the same spot for breakfast, avoid walking on cracks from cement, and has to do everything five times(Wash hands, lock the door, five m&m jars, sets of paper and more). After his neighbor, Simon(greg kinnear) gets his ass kicked by a couple of guys, he must take care of his dog, verdall. All of a sudden, Melvin is rejoiced and happy again, seeing that somebody actually cared for him. Another person is Melvin's life is Carol, a waitress(played by Helen Hunt); the thing with her is that she feels like a prisoner because her son has been sick since the day he was born. She is on to him every 24-7 without even catching a break. The only person who wants her to be free is her mother(shelly winters in her breakout role ever). One day after recovering from an accident, Simon has to go to Boston in order to get money from his parents to pay the medical bills. That is when the three main characters(simon, melvin and carol) get together on an odyssey that not only get to talk, but also feel more spirited and alive. This is by far the best film that I've seen Jack Nicholson in since Batman and A few good men. I rank this film # 16 on my top 20 list of best movies.4 Star Rating.Go see this movie.

title: Quite Literally As Good as a Romantic-Comedy gets.
content: A Very Nice and humorous film boosted by excellent performances from Jack Nicholson and Helen Hunt, showing us that friendship and love is a part of anyone's life.This Movie is about a Grumpy Writer Named Melvin Udall(Jack) who lives on his own in an apartment,and does not have any friends, and lives his life very disciplined,about how he develops a friendship with his Gay Neighbour(Greg) and a love interest towards a waitress of the restaurant he goes to have his breakfast(Helen).The Portrayal of Melvin from Jack Nicholson is quite honestly ''as good as it gets'' and he also got an Oscar for this role along with Helen Hunt who portrays a mother trying to cure her child's sickness while trying to find happiness at the same time quite brilliantly. The Supporting roles from Greg Kinnear and Shirley Knight are also well portrayed. The Director does a good job making this movie into a very good movie with a very good cast.This movie is very good mainly due to the excellent performances from Jack and Helen, and funny and anyone can watch it and enjoy it.

title: Greatest Movie Ever Made.
content: I can't say how much I love this movie.  You have Melvin (Nicholson) the guy who everyone loves to hate because he loves to hate everyone else, Carol (Hunt) the stressed waitress who's with an ailing son, and Simon (Kinnear) the neighbor who's life is falling apart.  Let's not forget Verdell the dog, because he's the catalyst that starts a chain reaction that changes the lives of all three people.  I guess the reason I like this movie so much is that it's about the fact that life is not perfect.

title: Huh?
content: Okay so this had two supposedly good actors in it, Hunt and Nicholson, but after that I fail to see what was so good about this hard to understand movie.Nicholson was supposed to be manic depressive or o c d ? I didn't see evidence of that. I had no idea what the movie was about most of the time and it failed to entertain me.Why was Hunt taking a bath in front of this injured guy? Was she an exhibitionist or something? Also Kinnear's character did not seem gay. The characters were not believable and if Nicholson was in the restaurant with her, he could not have been o c d.I would not recommend this movie to anyone. Unless you want to fall asleep. Also there is something wrong here, I am not shouting, just because I put in the initials o c d? That stands for obsessive compulsive and is *not* a misspelling as it should be capitalized! Geesh. So now I have to put it in wrong.

title: Highly recommended movie
content: Before seeing this film, I heard a lot of good things about it. Usually this builds my expectations so high that anything presented falls short. Not so with this movie. Jack Nicholson presents a very believable obsessive / compulsive person. His reactions are right on the money and make you believe he is Melvin, not an actor playing a part. An excellent and easy to follow storyline with a feel good conclusion. What more could a moviegoer ask?

title: One of the best!
content: In my opinion one of the best , I mean the very best movie I have seen. Jack Nicolson is absolutely sensational! Amazing amazing performance! It is very unfortunate that this move is not available in BlueRay in North America .

title: I already loved Helen Hunt...
content: ... And with this picture... Now I love Jack Nicholson... Both papers were made for them... Nicholson got personality and Helen, well, she was Helen... A lovely love story... You know... What can  say about the most beautiful woman alive... and the excellent performance on this picture... Cute.. innocent but not fool... lovely mother and brave... specially that... brave... Great movie!!!

title: Way to go Jack.
content: This is one of the movies I really enjoyed watching. What else can you do when Jack is at his very best?This is a great movie, MAKE SURE YOU SEE IT, even if you are not a Jack-fan. Many of you who don't like Jack will change your minds after seeing this one, he even looks cute (can't remember seeing that before).After seeing this movie, there was never a doubt in my mind, who would run away with the Oscar for best actor. Must say I was surprised that Helen got anything - okay she looks good in a wet T-shirt, but is that enough to win an Oscar?

title: A hilarious yet moving masterpiece
content: Words cannot express how awesome this film is. Every time I see it I cannot help but burst out laughing and burst into tears in equal measure. Everything about it is perfect. The quality of the acting, the subtle yet purposeful direction and warm true to life visuals all help squeeze the most out of what is an incredibly touching script.The film is about how passion for things, and for the people we love help us overcome the problems that we face in our everyday lives. It is also about that when you love someone, you both have to face compromise to get it to work and that because of compromising stuff you thought you had to do you can be a better person because of it.Jack Nicholson definitely deserved his Oscar for his performance as Melvin, a crazy author who has OCD, by managing to make him totally believable. It could have been so easy for him to go all out nuts and overact, taking away the charm and the warmth from his performance that lets us truly feel sorry for and sympathise with his character.All the other cast members were exceptional as well, with the guy who played the gay dude doing especially well. His performance as the man who is the complete opposite of Melvin and wears his emotions on his sleeve is especially important to make sure the film works. Helen Hunt does pretty nifty too and so many scenes in the film make me smile just because of the expressions on her face.The best thing about the film has to be the writing though. The are times in other films when lines of movie dialogue are seen as being exactly movie dialogue, but in As Good As It Gets everything seems real. The words are how a real person would say things, not just silly sound-bites that are charged up with emotional language that fools you into thinking they are deep and meaningful. Everything just feels true and natural, which really helps the movie swallow you whole until you are deep inside its warm, snuggly belly surrounded by the reality it creates and feeling every last trace of emotion.What is also really important to get across is that the film is also absolutely hilarious! There are the immediately amusing one-liners that make you chuckle and smile, but the film also manages to do more than this, setting it miles apart from your average comedy that throws around random words and and "zany" situations. Since you get so involved with the intricacies and quirks of each of the characters, the biggest laughs you will get out of the film are by simple facial expressions or the odd emphasised word that lets you know exactly what the character is thinking.You should really, REALLY watch this film. It is a masterpiece. It only gets better on repeat viewings as well. At the risk of being extremely cliché and cheesy, as far as romantic comedies go, it really is As Good As It Gets!

title: How did this film ever win Oscars?
content: Now and then a film comes along which is praised to the skies but which, when you see it, is just so dreadful that you wonder whether you are mad and the rest of the world is sane, or vice versa.This is a "comedy" which did not raise a single laugh in the cinema in which I saw it. The script is pathetic. Jack Nicholson over-acts dramatically as the central character, and my reaction to Helen Hunt was to hope that she spent as little time on screen as possible. In her TV role as an ugly, neurotic, abrasive wife she was superb. Seeing her in this film, you suddenly realise she probably wasn't acting. Remember the days when actresses looked like Sophia Loren, Doris Day, Marilyn Monroe, Jane Russell, etc? And comedies were genuinely funny and acted by the likes of Cary Grant? Whatever has happened to the American movie?

title: "as good as it gets" is as good as it gets.
content: "as good as it gets" is as good as it gets.What an amazing feel good movie. The performances are just so amazing. Jack Nicolson is from a different league, he was just amazing. What i really loved is Helen hunts performance, what an amazing performance. I was just in love with her character and the actress. The combination scenes between jack and Helen were just amazing. The dialogues were so nice, they do get dramatic at places but its so natural and feels very organic. Greg Kinnear gave an amazing performance. The writing is amazing, the characters are written so nicely. The relationship and its complexities among the characters were explored so nicely. I loved the dog in the movie. Its an amazing movie, just watch it if you haven't.

title: Very good
content: Jack nicholson acting is very good, cute love story betwren two unexpected people. If love stories are your thing, then definetly you will like this.

title: As good but not as funny as it gets
content: This movie deals with a lot of drama and angst. It tries to be funny, but really it can not. With that said it is a good and deep feel good story. The story enables one to see a character that has all of the advantages fail in every department, except having money. It has good drama and great lines, like "You make me want to be a better man". The movie shows several people at their worst and contains some logical plot twists that come out of nowhere, like what happens to the one Character near the end to enable him to go on with his life. The comedy of the movie seems to fail because it is all directed at picking on one character who is politically incorrect, like a Norman Lear television show. I really did not find many Norman Lear shows funny.

title: AS BAD AS YOU CAN IMAGINE !!
content: I don't understand what people have liked so much about this movie.I recognize that Nicholson's performance was good ( although I disliked his character so much. He was a jerk ). ( BY THE WAY, IF YOU LIKE TO SEE STUPIDS IN A REALLY EXCELLENT MOVIE, YOU SHOULD SEE "RAIN MAN"  OR "FORREST GUMP"  "ACE VENTURA" OR "LIAR LIAR"; THOSE ARE PRETTY GOOD MOVIES )The whole movie is very stupid. It's an unbelievable story ( who would like to live with a person like Udall. Could anybody call this relation: LOVE ? )Helen Hunt is terrible in this movie. I think that she won the Oscar only for showing her back when the guy made a picture of her.  ( KATE WINSLET WAS DEFINITELY THE BEST )Well, I think this is AS BAD AS IT GETS... A WASTE OF TIME !!I ended totally disappointed after watching it.

title: Crackpot finds love and an unlikely gay friend
content: I have now watched the film 3 times but not yet at the cinema. It seems to me to be better, more subtle and more thought provoking each time I watch it. Jack Nicholson, playing the neurotic Melvin Udall, is worth every plaudit the great actor has received. The first part of the film establishes him has a most unlikable character, so much so that when he starts to do kindnesses one feels disorientated. Helen Hunt as Carol the waitress in Melvin's favourite restaurant is an admirable foil to Melvin's battyness; calm, sensible, yet beset by worry about her son's illness. She establishes her part in the film with assured, entirely believable acting. Melvin takes on the unlikely role of pet sitter to gay artist neighbour (Greg Kinnear) Simon's dog (which we already know he hates). This unlikely happening is accomplished by excellent acting by all concerned not least Simon's unscrupulous male model . Carol (the only waitress that Melvin trusts) has to take time off because her son is ill. Melvin uses the considerable financial clout he wields as a successful author to employ a doctor (admirably played by Lawrence Kasden)to treat the boy. Carol, though grateful, suspects that Melvin's motives are less than pure. We, the audience, believe that Melvin only wanted to be fed but maybe Carol puts ideas into his head ...Meanwhile the counter plot of Simon having fallen on hard times leads to a visit of the trio to Baltimore and a chance for relationships to develop not always comfortably. Watch this splendid movie with a loved one but without interruption. With luck you will be moved to be kinder to all the human oddities who cross your path.

title: so fine
content: i never tire of seeing this movie. so well written, so well acted, so well produced, and so wonderfully human. as an episcopal priest i am convinced that film can be more transforming than a thousand sermons (if its as good as this one).the line i love the most is Nicholson's's saying to hunt is "you make me want to be better than i am" his silence before he spoke, and then an intro that seemed to be setting us up for sarcasm. that sentence was the announcement of his metamorphosis and it revealed that his ability to so accurately judge someone else at the deepest level, a reaction to hunt's confrontation and a challenge to Nicholson's that demanded the best that he had and did he have it in that moment!i laughed wonderfully through out the movie but i was pulling for both main characters as well as those with supporting roles (including the dog). sometimes film can be a vicarious journey for the viewer where they can find satisfaction in briefly becoming the person they would hope to be. this film did for me.

title: This is as good as it gets.
content: Psychological healing is so rare and so hard that stories that portray it well are rare in deed. This story is so beautifully told and so well acted that my wife and I use quotes from it as short-hand for complex emotional commentary on current events. If you have never seen it, you are lucky because the story is timeless and you get to watch it for the first time. Among the few good reasons to look forward to the memory lapses of old age is the potential of seeing this movie again for the first time.

title: Good fun
content: Tolerance and love. Two words that tell a lot about the movie. It was good fun.

title: Return to Terms of Endearment
content: James Brooks is clearly at the center of this mess. First, he dishes out the totally lame Terms of Endearment, then he goes back to the same formula of TV-like performances, to the oohs and ahhhs of the Oscar voters, to give us As Good As it Gets, which could almost be its cousin. What is the attraction for these over the top, unrealistic performances?? Nicholson was leading actor in both, and they both stunk. As Good As it Gets goes on forever, like a bad soap opera that won't end, just like "Terms" did. All three leading actors have done so much better in other efforts, but I put the blame on "Mary Tyler Brooks" for making this pastiche as nauseatingly bad as it is. These two movies make a good case for having chimpanzees choose Oscar winners.

title: The Funniest Movie I've ever seen!
content: I laughed so hard when I saw this movie in the theatre, I thought I was gonna die. Then we bought it on PPV, and I almost died again from laughing so hard. See this movie now! I give it a 10! Rated PG-13 for strong language, thematic elements, nudity, and some violence.

title: A fabulous film, with a great cast and excellent acting
content: As a comedy romance, this film is one of the best, being of a genre which has always irritated me, with the exception of 'When Harry Met Sally', this film really enlightened me. The acting in this film is second to none and Jack Nicolson puts on a convincing and touchng performance...the man you really want to hate but you just can't resist loving him. Greg Kinnear is superb also, portraying the homosexual man who has to rebuild his life. Cute dog too.

title: A lovely un-run-of-the-mill romantic comedy
content: While romantic comedies have been young lovers' territory (from When Harry met Sally to Sliding Doors), As Good As It Gets approaches romance from an older point of view.  Jack Nicholson is suitably casted into this spitting, obsessive role, while Helen Hunt melts into her portrayal of Carol.  Greg Kinnear, while not winning an Oscar, is also convincing while a brilliant supporting cast with Cuba Gooding Jr, Yeardley Smith and others keep the story going.  Touching, sweet and at times funny, this romantic comi-drama is wonderful entertainment.

title: Most entertaining film of the 90s
content: This film has the cleverest script of any I saw in a decade.  I saw it with low expectations, expecting to experience an educational struggle through another story about people in sad situations, which include the burden of mental illness.  Within five minutes I was gripped by it and not released until the end.  The writing is just so good and the delivery by the two principals is superb.  No fan of Helen Hunt in other roles I was amazed by her performance in this.  Nicholson is in good form, and the role suits him, but she is just terrific.  This one is a must see.

title: A view some 16 years later
content: If I had written this in 1997 when the movie came out, I would have said bizarre, weird, hard to follow, full of eccentric characters who I usually like. Sort of like my life during the late 60s. But not a movie I thought I would care to see again.But here it is 16 years later - a lifetime has passed, both for me and for this country. The film is comforting, a link back to how life used to be for many of us, those of us who chose to live in metropolitan areas around all kinds of folks. Where perhaps we ourselves fit in better - rather than a small town environment where everyone knows everyone else's business.The one character who is grounded is Helen Hunt's mother - especially with her comment towards the end about no relationship being sane. So true.

title: Blech. How could these two win Academy Awards?
content: As Good as it Gets was the second most overrated film of 1997. (Guess which one was first, you ship-lovers?) I was not amused in the least with Nicholson's obsessive-compulsive schtick nor with Hunt's neurotic waitress. I wish the Academy would recognize actresses who actually work long and hard to perfect the nuances of their characters' personalities, instead of those who can only play one cracked-up role.I didn't laugh once throughout this entire movie. What was so funny? That this sad man had to wash his hands 100 times? No, not really. That silly little dog? Nope. The only bright spot in this movie was Greg Kinnear's gay artist. That's it!Don't believe the hype. This movie is nothing special and it wastes Jack Nicholson and Greg Kinnear. As for Helen Hunt, she needs to stick to television. No one should have to pay good money to see her whine.

title: RAW & REAL
content: EMOTIONS ARE VERY RAW & REAL No wonder it garnered Academy Awards & nominations for the actors & crew.

title: Eye for an eye; a tooth for the truth
content: This is a comedy with brain included in the making of the manuscript. Rare. I see no point of giving this movie less than ten points. Jack Nicholson is playing an author with psychical problems, -such as having to lock and unlock his front door five times every time he comes back or leaves home. Aw.... C'mon. Just watch it!

title: Made me want to look again
content: If Jack can find it again perhaps for the first time for him in the movie, I'm open to try. Love is a give and take thing, and you're never sure of where it'll happen just have to be open and willing to express yourself truly. I liked where they went out for rolls and he expressed himself. I'm a bit confused myself if "This is as good as it gets" maybe I had it already? I was with a wonderful woman just didn't see it at the time, we do have two wonderful children. I just made some mistakes in what I thought was important, I'm of clearer mind now.So yeah this is a good movie, one that makes you think. It's a comedy but also a drama

title: Truly enjoyable, well made movie
content: I personally thought As Good as it Gets was the best movie of the year. All the actors involved gave sparkling performances and it had me laughing all the way through. Jill and Timer, the dogs who played Verdell, were well trained and painfully adorable. While I must admit it was slightly unbelievable, hey its a movie!

title: It's all about the buy in
content: This is a very simple movie to like or not. I freely admit there's not much here. The story is unrealistic and painfully obvious, but so what? This enjoyment of this movie hinges solely on, "Do you buy the characters?" That's it. If you buy the interplay between Nicholson, Hunt, and Kinear then you will enjoy, and probably really enjoy, this movie. If not, well?The characters are unpleasant, unpredictable, and in many ways unlikable, but if you see them as folks who are doing the best they can with the hand that's been dealt to them, then it is very easy to also see them as human. I do, and so I love this movie. I make no apologies for it's shortfalls, I love it. Full stop.

title: As good as it gets
content: I was desperate to watch a movie on the new years eve, so like always i landed up at the movie joint, & after flipping a coin i landed on "as good as it gets".As Lonely i was getting ,i could hear ticks of the clock, i started watching.Time flew. The gist is short, but the script surely makes up, leaving Jack's expressions a bonus to watch.I don't want to summarize the movie, for its always exciting to watch the unknown. Better save this movie for someday special. "As good as it gets" surely deserves a 9.

title: The name says it all
content: There's no need to talk about plot or characters as there's enough reviews already doing that so Ill start off by saying As good As It Gets is Simply one of my favourite movies ever, Melvin is my hero. So much more than a typical romantic comedy. The humour is subtle but perfect with some real laugh out loud moments mixed into the general smooth quirkiness, the pace of the movie is perfect, the acting is sublime. Nicholson deservedly gets most of the plaudits for the acting in this, but every character in it could not be better portrayed, even the dog Verdell could teach lassie a thing or two about acting. I've grown really fond of every character in it. I smile from start to finish each time I've watched it.

title: Contemporary Classic
content: Jack Nicholson, from what I've seen so far, has never given a bad performance in his life. This is no exception to that claim. Even more, As Good As It Gets is a slight departure from his trademark screen persona, a snakily charming, confident, and dry man with a penchant for almost comically devilish eyebrow movements and sharky grins. Instead, here he is an older man with insecurities so overwhelming that he desperately hides it all underneath a wry and crude meanness that he jabs at nearly everyone he meets, harming them first before they can do what he fears out of a corrosive neuroses, which is that they'll harm his fragile ego first. He only begins to realize how much he yearns to be liked after so many unfortunate things happen to his neighbor, inadvertently causing so many fortunate things to happen to him, giving him a taste of how good life gets before things once again even out, making him want to become a better man.Helen Hunt's tremendously human performance stands out almost as far as Nicholson's, a feat that has since the 1970s been quite difficult to accomplish. To equal Nicholson's naturally upstaging presence is quite impressive. She seems almost as if she was born to play the waitress whose ill son is constantly on her mind but always keeps that winning smile on her face. She is very funny and deeply felt, imperfect and in such a realistic way.The film's breakthrough comes from Greg Kinnear, whose charm affects the sensitive role he plays, a homosexual painter, constantly under the heterosexual gun, often held by the nasty shell of the Nicholson character, and unfairly given the inarguably shortest end of the straw, yet always patient and accepting enough, until he reaches a point. Kinnear has an airy promptness and propensity for physical drama that make him a perfect counterpart for the other two stars.Something I find infinitely appealing about As Good As It Gets is its focus on the dog as a character. The dog is billed (as three different dogs) in the credits, and is developed as a character, as an interesting friendship grows between him and the Nicholson character, and grows into an adapter for the relationship between Nicholson and Kinnear.As Good As It Gets is one of the most well-written films I've seen recently. In it is hilarious humor, heartfelt character drama, and a chain of seemingly unrelated events with three different people rippling towards each other. Its extensive running time is due to its passionate development and concentration on these three very different people and their colliding lives.

title: Poor execution
content: This movie had some really poor attempts at humor.  The drama was sappy and what is the big deal about Helen Hunt's performance.  It's just a Mad About You rehash.  The woman so far CAN'T ACT.  Nicholson was business as usual and Greg Kinnear was definitely trying too hard.  I found this movie incredibly boring and the script was bland.  This seemed to me like a grown up version of Jerry Macguire.  This is overrated to say the least.

title: This truly IS As Good As it Gets
content: The first time I saw this movie, I thought: 'Jack Nicholson is the greatest'. The second time I saw this movie, I thought: 'Greg Kinnear is really something'. I saw it a third time and thought: 'Wow, that Helen Hunt sure is amazing'. The fourth time I was in awe of Cuba Gooding Jr. Last time I saw it (must've been the 41st time), I wasn't thinking anymore, I was being part of the movie.I can't explain the charm and wit of this movie, but it's a movie you can't ignore with a good conscience. (Is that con-science?).Melvin is an interesting character with interesting flaws, he's interested in Carol the waitress and mostly uninterested in everything else. He has his own interesting views on absolutely everything, and he's easy to dislike - at first. But then you succumb and you fall in love with Melvin Udall, the writer of fiction for women (with no sense or accountability).This movie goes from A to Z. It opens and it ends. No overdoing here, just simple movie-magic.*****/*****

title: Love Helen Hunt!!!!!!!
content: Melvin is a romantic novelist who is a selfish manic compulsive who is rude and insulting to all he meets. When Melvin's gay neighbour is beaten up and robbed, Melvin agrees to look after his dog. The dog gives Melvin something to care about other than himself and his life is approaching normal until his regular waitress has to leave work to look after her asthmatic son and his neighbour wants his dog back. Melvin starts to realise that his life needs others for more than just selfish reasons.The big Oscar winner for Jack is recent years is enjoyable if you come to it knowing what to expect. The film is very sentimental but in a good way. The film is gently comic and amusing and the characters (although exaggerated) are winning and involving. The telling is a little long winded at times and the film could have been shorter but it is still enjoyable. It does tip over into sickly sentimentality at times and can be a bit syrupy but it comes with the territory.Nicholson is excellent and is the main reason it all works well. His un-PC Melvin is funny but also a character that you can hate and pity on several occasions. Kinnear is good because he is a solid understated character and not hammy or OTT like he can be. Hunt is good but is left with the majority of the syrup and sentiment where the other characters get more share of the laughs. Gooding Jr continues his trend of being good in over the top roles and is funny and happily avoids becoming a flaming gay stereotype.Overall this is a sentimental romantic comedy that is typical for the genre. The story wanders to it's point but the good cast, led by a great Nicholson, hold the whole thing together. A superior piece of sentimentality.

title: As Good as it is
content: Great watch, would watch again, and can recommend.I might just be a sucker for a neurological disorder flick, but there are so many depths to this movie about our capabilities as people, control, and seeking our goals vs our comforts.If you need proof that Jack Nicholson or Helen Hunt are top actors, then get in the way back machine and see how they did a "serious", but funny movie in the late nineties.This one has a little bit of everything, definitely worth checking out.

title: Well deserved Academies
content: Recently became a big fan of Jack Nicolson but one thing was getting settled in my mind that this guy can do all the psycho kind of roles only. But this movie just took it all away. He was hilarious, his charactere was developed quite nicely from scene 1 itself. He very much carries his usual style but this time it was given different flavors. He looked relax compared to what he usually does. In short it was unbelievable that this guy can also work in a romantic comedy. Well talking of romance this movie had its own way of putting out. The lovey-dovey dialogues between Nicholson and Hunt were long but at the end they did leave a sweet taste on tongue and make you say yes these are "GETTERS". The chemistry between both is great too and performance wise also it looks as if they both are pulling each other's level up. Hence the Oscars.

title: You don't know Jack
content: Actually Jack might not know Jack ... but wait, Jack (Nicholson) is the actor and not the character name. So I reckon I should've used the character name ... but too late for that now. It is never too late to (re)watch this though. It had been quite some time for me. And I had forgotten certain things. I had not forgotten how beautiful Holly Hunter looked ... before she decided that surgeries would help her be ... forever young. Well let's just say that plan backfired.But back to this and no pun concerning her state being as good as it get and deteriorating from that point ... she plays her role as good as Nicholson does his. Even when Nicholson is at his worst behavior ... we forgive him, because it is made clear, that he can't help himself.But it's not just those two: the cast is amazing to say the least. There is much to be found here. About human nature ... about dogs too. Well about sweet little dogs that is. A great movie that deservedly got a couple of Oscars ...

content: This movie is the longest movie I've ever seen. I swear they played 3 showings of Titanic in the next theatre. Could this be any more boring? Okay, call me immature, fine. But I need more than Jack Nicholson hopping on the sidewalk, a gay guy, and Helen Hunt in a wet t-shirt to make this movie good. I know there are people reading this and saying, "What are you talking about?" Well, if that's you, please post to set me straight. And I suggest some activity in your life, or at least rent Armageddon.

title: Nancing around AcmeVideo are you?
content: Well decide on 'As Good As It Gets', wonderful journey of an Obsessive Compulsive novelist (aren't they all?) a restaurant waitress and an artisan neighbor.  The film has beautiful character development right from the start, few subtleties encountered along its story line.  It takes place in New York and creeps its way through the psyche of the 3 main characters. Scored with appropriate music to keep pace with the film, its full of laughs and cry's and intellectual action if that is what you sometimes prefer. I first saw this movie on the plane, piped through the intercom unedited. It does have some cursing and bias, so perhaps not a family film.  Supporting cast members do a brilliant job.  The DVD includes commentary with James L Brooks, and the 3 main characters, a great addition to an Academy awarded film (1997). 9/10

title: Jackie Simpson is the same as Bart Simpson!
content: Jack Nicholson took home his third Oscar for "As Good as It Gets", playing grouchy Melvin Udall, who becomes friends - if a little unwillingly - with single mom Carol Connelly (Helen Hunt) and gay artist Simon Bishop (Greg Kinnear). With Nicholson in the role, it's pretty much guaranteed that the whole thing's gonna be neat. Especially that line about how to write women really well. I can't believe that "Titanic" defeated this for Best Picture (actually, my favorite 1997 movie was "In & Out"). But, at least Nicholson and Hunt won Oscars...there was a reason that Leonardo DiCaprio wasn't nominated for an Oscar for "Titanic". All in all, "AGAIG" is a comedy classic.

title: Jack
content: I like the bit where he says you can't handle the truth.

title: Aged, and filled with unfortunate messages, but beautifully acted and still good
content:
When I first watched this movie, when it came out, I thought it was great - a wonderful, evergreen movie that could not possibly lose its shine. I watched it a few times over the years. And more recently I watched it with my wife a few days ago.And... well, there was a question that suddenly entered my mind just before I pressed play, which was, "how much misoginy is built into this movie?" My memory was hazy, but I suspected the answer was "quite a bit"... And I wasn't wrong, sadly.(minor spoilers)
The central plot is essentially Beauty and the Beast. Monster falls in love with Beauty, who eventually redeems him and turns him into a better person. The protagonist, Melvin, masterfully played by Jack Nicholson, may not be as hairy as the fairy tale, but he starts off as a racist, misogynist, homophobic, rude and aggressive straight old white guy. To belabour the point, they have him throw a cute dog down a garbage chute. In short, Melvin is bad through and through. To make this worse, this terrible behaviour of his is pinned on his mental health - he has OCD, therefore that excuses him being such a terrible human. It's like they were trying to play intersectionality bingo and annoy all the minority groups at once.Throughout the tale, Melvin continues to be very unpleasant (the profanity filter forbids me from using the right word here) to all kinds of people. He uses his considerable wealth as a successful author to sort out a medical problem that the poverty-stricken waitress Carol (masterfully played by Helen Hunt) can't solve herself, and then leverages that to coerce her into going on a road trip with her and his gay neighbour whom he's reluctantly (mostly because she might go on the trip) agreed to take to see his parents.During this trip, he continues to behave appallingly to everyone. At one point, after having it demanded of him under threat of her walking out of the restaurant, Melvin manages to summon one little compliment for the woman he apparently desires. He is immediately rewarded with both praise ("this is the best compliment I've ever received") and a kiss. Eventually, without having changed all that much, just maybe softened up a little bit, but still being his weird and unpleasant self, Melvin essentially gets the girl.Along this is a side story where the gay neighbour Simon (masterfully played by Greg Kinnear) is beaten up, loses his flat and is broke (also due to medical bills; welcome to the US), and loses his inspiration to paint, which was how he earned money. He is also miraculously saved by the mere nearness of Carol, who seems to truly be a fairy tale princess, since she apparently not only turns Melvin into a slightly less awful human being, but also inspires a gay artist who normally paints male figures into painting female figures. Do I smell a whiff of some kind of "she can turn gay people straight" essence here? Maybe. Either way it's pretty dubious.So, in 2019, I found this loveable movie harder to love.What saves it, and deserves the 4 star rating, is the great performances by the actors, who bring this flawed script to life like the masters of their craft that they are. And when it finishes, your heart may well feel a bit warmed.But I wouldn't show it to my children, or to anyone lacking the ability to come to their own conclusions about the biases of the script. The underlying messages are too toxic.

title: Touching or Tragic?
content: Are we bothered at the end of the film that nothing is really resolved between Melvin and Carol? Melvin will still be an obsessive compulsive and Carol will still be taking midnight trips to the hospital with Spencer. I find that to be an incredibly tragic element to the film. The fact that both characters found each other is touching, but Brooks structures it to show us that while there are happy endings, there's still reality.The brilliance of the film also lies within the simple fact that this is not a comedy. While Nicholson has many snappy one-liners and insult jokes at the expense of Greg Kinnear's Simon, the film is still as tragic and as deep as one of Shakespeare's sonnets. When Nicholson learns that Verdell is to be taken away from him, he's lost something that he has grown attached to and for a man in his position, it is loss at the deepest level. Verdell represents harmony for Melvin. Melvin is in harmony with the world when Verdell is around. There is a kinship between Verdell and Melvin that is quite lovely, but also quite tragic. As the film progresses, Carol represents harmony, thus their strong relationship emerges. Both Melvin and Carol are two lost souls searching not for the right answers, but for a place to start the search for the right answers.

title: Best film of 1997!
content: This is by far the best film of 1997!  The hell with "Titanic".  That movie didn't have the performance level, script, and directing this one did.  Jack Nicholson and Helen Hunt both won Oscars (Actor and Actress) for playing their very different New Yorker characters.  Jack (my favorite modern actor) is hilarious as an obsessive compulsive, and Helen (one of my favorite modern actresses) is the light of the movie as a waitress.  The only thing that suprises me is the fact that Greg Kinnear didn't win the Best Supporting Actor Oscar.  He is superb as a gay artist that gets attacked and is down on his luck.  Take my word if you  see one film from 1997, this is it.

title: Good movie with great performances from Hunt and Nicholson. Proving most of all a relationship of friendship is the most important thing even if no romance is present.
content: James L. Brooks has done it again he took a story and made it great with interesting characters. The performances of Jack Nicholson and Helen Hunt turned just great the chemistry between the two was the best ever, both Oscar winners that were well deserved. I have to hand it to Jack time after time he proves he can take on characters with the most complex and odd behaviors just plain out crazy people. Nicholson gives a show-stopping performance as writer Melvin Udall, an obsessive-compulsive with one of Manhattan's meanest tempers. Melvin is to be helped along after his gay neighbor Simon (Greg Kinnear) is hospitalized and more unexpected kindness-comes along with waitress Carol Connelly (Helen Hunt) who helps put Melvin back in the human race. This film as you see in the end and really the whole time that a male and female relationship can be based on friendship and not sex and romance. It is the things we do for others that helps and makes our world seem better. Remember a friendship is important no matter what the age of a person or who they are. This is much the way the relationship of the characters of Jack and Helen can be described. Jack Nicholson also continues to get better with age his performance in this movie is a knockout! As Good As It Gets is a classic movie to watch just to feel important and see the great Jack at work.

title: As Good As It Gets
content: 'As Good As It Gets' is about a man, Mr. Udall played by Jack Nicholson, with a social disorder that offends almost every person he comes in contact with. He makes rude and offensive comments and has no control over himself. He meets a waitress, Carol Connelly played by Helen Hunt, who is able to tolerate most of his behavior. She is not afraid to put him in his place when he steps over bounds with her. Mr. Udall comes to her restaurant where only she can serve him. He is rude to other customers if they are sitting in his spot. He finds that he is very dependent on her service and goes to her home when she stops coming to work. At first this is scary to her. Mr. Udall finds that Carol is home with her sick child and sends a much needed doctor over to tend to her child. She accepts reluctantly but only because her son's condition is pretty bad. Mr. Udall asks for a favor in return and this puts the two of them on a road trip. They go through some ups and downs and discover more and more about each other.The theme is centered on Mr. Udall and the emotional effect he has on people. He is such an abrasive person that it is unbelievable. He says outrageously offensive things to just about everyone he comes in contact with and he shows little to no remorse. Mr. Udall is lucky that he finds someone who is able to tolerate most of his behavior. Jack Nicholson plays the part of Mr. Udall perfectly.Mr. Udall's gay neighbor, Simon played by Greg Kinnear, brings out some of the good in Mr. Udall. It starts with Simon's dog, Verdell, who starts favoring Mr. Udall over Simon. This sounds impossible in theory but it happens. This is when the story starts to show a good side to Mr. Udall.This movie is like the movie "Citizen Kane". Both have a plot based on memorable characters. Charley Kane and Mr. Udall are both characters that made quite an impression on many. They are not individuals who are like everyone else. Both stand out in many different ways.The close up angles are used with great tasted. One example is when there is a close up on Verdell and Mr. Udall and it gives a lasting impression. The sound effects are great and add to the emotional effects of the story. The director, producer, and editors have done a wonderful job.

title: Better than expected
content: I just saw this film for the first time. Did not expect much of it, but the versatile story, humor that struck me as well the true professionals Nicholson and Hunt made this drama an enjoyable piece of art. Via this film, I fell in love in Helen Hunt (I wish I met her some day!). Her ability to show various feelings without words is excellent (and heart-breaking). Also Nicholson does his body language in a way only a master can do. Those two great actors had a good balance (too often one superior actor/ actress steals all attention). The happy end was not a surprise, but it was created with a sensitive way not having too much of sugar and sentimentality. I recommend this drama to all romantic people - and to those who wish to be a such.

title: Gods creation.
content: When God puts his hand into movies that's what you end up getting: A masterpiece.. this movie made me want to be a better man.
