Jack Nicholson delivers his "Carol the waitresss, Simon the fag" so perfectly dead pan and matter of factly that i fell about laughing. the only niggle i had was that melvin udall never comes out and says clearly to the others that he is sick  and can't quite help being the way he is. we are left to guess how much of his personality is controllable and how much better he really could be.

title: Good story, perfectly cast, superb result -- Improves each viewing
content: This is a highly realistic story that is perfectly cast.  I have seen the picture three times and it got better each time. The reason for the improvement was my noticing the details of the acting and the story with subsequent viewings.  For instance in the Baltimore restaurant when Nicholson complains that he has to have a coat and tie when Hunt needs only a house dress is priceless in Nicholson's character complete lack of personal communication skills.

title: I didn't see a movie which was so funny in two years.
content: Melvin Udal is the main character. He is cynical, but he has a great sense of humor. Deep down inside Melvin Udal lives a nice man. The next day when the washing machine repair man came to my door to deliver a new machine and said not to take it upstairs, I repeated the words Melvin Udal said to his neighbours. Just some funny remarks to scare the simple repairman. I had to laugh when he was gone and saw Melvin Udals face. The film will keep my mind busy for a long time.

title: Jack NiceManson
content: This is a very funny movie with a lot of heart. Its a very well rounded story, with possibly one of the greatest character arcs I've ever seen on screen. It's simple but fun to watch Jack Nicholson's character turn from a jerk to a charitable man. Jack Nicholson is good in this, even though he looks like a serial killer he is a rather funny guy who can clearly pull off difficult roles. I'm not a Helen Hunt fan but I like her in this.I'm not too comfortable with a Helen Hunt and a Jack Nicholson romance. If you ask me, he should be gettin with her mother. It almost seems like a Woody Allen movie lol. But that's okay, I'm glad that wasn't the focus of the movie. Also I don't mind woody Allen movies.

title: It's Not Only As Good As It Gets
content: This movie is by right better than "Titanic", but not as good as "Good Will Hunting". The storyline is so appealing that it captured the my attention from beginning to end, except for the ending.The three lead actors, Jack Nicholson, Helen Hunt, and Greg Kinnear, are brilliant. They all deserve Oscar, and they all would have gotten it, if only this movie was not competing against "Good Will Hunting". Greg Kinnear lost to Robin Williams, but he surely was his only true competitor that year.Well, what can I say? People in Hollywood still prefer big budget romantic movies with young actors instead of this kind of movie...

title: How rude people can be great to watch...
content: If there is one actor that has done a very good job in almost all the movies he ever played in, than it must be Jack Nicholson. He's one of the most constant actors I know off and with this movie he proves his many talents once again...This time he is Melvin Udall, a cranky, selfish, extremely rude and obsessive-compulsive writer who hates everybody and everything, especially his homosexual neighbor with his cute little dog. When his neighbor has been brutally beaten and needs to be hospitalized, Melvin is entrusted to the care of the dog he hates so much. His entire life is turned upside down and to make things worse: the only waitress who tolerated him at the only restaurant where he eats his daily breakfast, needs to leave work to care for her sick son, making it from then on impossible for Melvin to eat his breakfast. All this makes him realize that perhaps he needs others for more than just selfish reasons...Of course you could say that this is yet another sentimental, romantic comedy / drama, like we have seen so many more before and in a way that is true. But it is mainly thanks to the cast's and especially Jack Nicholson's excellent performance, that this movie is lifted above the average in the genre. I'm sure that there aren't many actors who are able to make Melvin a person who you love to hate at first, but who also has something likable about him. Jack Nicholson is one of those actors and he really did a very nice job in this movie.But next to the excellent acting, I must also admit that the story was well-written and that the humor worked perfectly. Sure it is all quite predictable: It's the typical stuff of people who are each-others opposites, but start accepting and even liking each other in the end. But the thing is that it works very well this time and that's all that matters to me when I'm watching a movie. Somehow the writer and director have found a way to make it all more than just bearable or watchable. They have made a fine comedy out of it and that's why I give this movie a 7.5/10.

title: An enjoyable, unexpected pleasure
content: With Jack Nicholson playing this role, the script writes itself. He is still one of the best actors of his generation, pulling off some sketchy dialogue and awkward scenes with the ease of a hand magician. He takes this movie on his shoulders and carries it almost all the way through.I don't get Helen Hunt. She has her moments - her scenes with Nicholson as he tries to complement her are priceless - but she just doesn't have the emotional range to pull it off. She tries, but her high-profile scenes don't ring true. She was upstaged by Greg Kinnear for Christ's sake - and SHE was naked!Well directed for the most part - there are some pacing problems, and this movie falls victim to "great line" disease. Great pieces of dialogue are framed by clumsy directorial arrows pointing to us and it, telling us that what we're about to hear is great dialogue. Still, it IS great dialogue. Overall, this is an enjoyable, unexpected pleasure.

title: Imperfection at its finest.
content: No hot models.  No action heros.  No 'sappy' unrealistic love story.  No intricate plot with twists and turns.  Just arguably the best movie of 1997.How?  Great acting and a great story.  Sounds too simple?Basically, they took some odd, flawed characters that have little to do with each other, and make a great movie by bringing them together through some very unique circumstances and poking fun at all of them, but bringing you closer to them as you go.  Character development is a large part of the movie.I laughed at several scenes and felt moved in others.  The funny scenes weren't corny and the heart-warming scenes weren't sappy.  This movie is different than the normal movie, which is a big plus.  The cast and their acting makes it all work.  Probably the best all-around movie of 1997 in my opinion.

title: If you don't like this, your made of jello
content: Its all been said and better than I can say it. What a great film.  It just shows that with the will, a plot, and some good actors, ENTERTAINMENT (note the caps!)... LIVES!  Don't be put off by the description, you won't be challenged, you won't become over emotional (unless, like me, your a softy), but if your here, you love great movies. See  It! Try to find reasons for not liking it - bet you can't!.

title: Over rated
content: Some admirable intentions in trying to develop some original non-cliched characters that interact over an unusual plot line.  Partly successful, but the weighty presence of Nicholson actually hinders the director's intentions.  Yes it's quite entertaining, but it's way too long and not half as clever as it thinks it is.

title: There´s no possible remake of this movie!
content: This is the movie I´ll never get tired of watching. I think it´s perfect! Incredible dialogues to match incredible characters/actors. The cast is just perfect! There´s no possible remake of this movie! No one can replace Jack Nicholson as Melvin Udall or Helen Hunt as "Carol, the waitress" or any of the others for that matter! Like I said it´s perfect!

title: Oscar worthy performance by Jack Nicholson
content: Jack Nicholson won an Oscar for this role and I absolutely think that he Deserves it one hundred percent.Let's star off with the plot , follows Melvin a guy that isn't very likeable and faces some situations that actually improves his personality while that process is a little slow in this film the movie feels actually longer than it is which is not a bad thing because of many factors that made this movie very good.Jack Nicholson's acting is undoubtedly Amazing he did an amazing job he portrayed a character that isn't likable in a way that he made him likeable in a way , he is a bit gritty as a character which adds that dynamic to his character and there are some subtle jokes and mocks that his character makes which are amazing and were absolutely necessary to make us see this character in more ways and scenarios. Helen Hunt's acting also was pretty good her character had some ups and downs and had a significant impact to Jack Nicholson's character which is nice in the way of how character development goes. And I also like that Harold Ramis had a part in this !Overall an Oscar worthy performance of the legendary Jack Nicholson and all of the cast did a good Job and overall the plot was something interesting and overall the movie was fun and the score by Hans Zimmer was great also . 8/10.

title: "There are Jews at My Table"
content: Really Jack you haven't seen Jews before in NYC until today? Amazing.This film overall is good, but for cringeworthy scenes like the above--and others--my rating has decreased over the years. Another scene is when Helen Hunt is telling the doctor about her asthmatic child's experiences in the ER, saying that after one full-blown attack, the ER doc gave the child the wrong kind of antibiotic. Well, you don't give an antibiotic for an asthma attack. This is not necessarily a script oversight, unfortunately I've seen this in medical practice where the docs throw it all against the wall and see what sticks. And naturally the patient thinks this is the standard of care but I digress.Helen Hunt was especially annoying in this film. Nicholson's character was obviously off his head, but Hunt would get annoyed at the tamest slight.Good film and good performances from Kinnear, Nicholson and Cuba Gooding.
